title: Machine-wide hardcoded secrets audit and migration to 1Password
description: Scan entire Mac for hardcoded API keys, tokens, and secrets in config files from the past year. Check 1Password first before creating new items. Migrate all secrets to appropriate vaults.

acceptanceCriteria.text: === DISCOVERY PHASE ===
Scan ~/.claude/ for hardcoded keys (settings.json, .claude.json files)
Scan ~/.config/ for API keys and tokens
Scan ~/Gits/*/.env* files (not .env.template)
Scan ~/Gits/*/.claude.json for MCP server secrets
Scan ~/Gits/*/package.json for embedded tokens
Document all findings in docs.local/audits/AUDIT-005-secrets.md
=== VERIFICATION PHASE ===
For each secret found, check if already in 1Password: op item list --tags api-key
Check development vault for existing dev tool secrets
Check project vaults (Domica, Cantaloupe, etc.) for project secrets
Mark duplicates - don't create if already exists
=== MIGRATION PHASE ===
Create missing secrets in appropriate vaults with proper tags
Replace hardcoded values with op:// references where supported
Update .claude.json files to use op:// references
Update .env files to .env.template with op:// references
=== CLEANUP PHASE ===
Remove plaintext secrets from config files
Add .env to .gitignore if not present
Verify all projects still work after migration
Run CodeRabbit review - must pass (or create BUG if unfixable)
Commit: chore: AUDIT-005 migrate hardcoded secrets to 1Password
